mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Stephen Williamson to Martha Washington, 1800 January 16
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Williamson, Stephen
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Stephen Williamson writes from the state prison in Philadelphia and introduces himself as the captain of a company in the Rhode Island Regiment who served under Washington in the Revolutionary War. He recounts a dream he had in which she gives birth to a son following Washington's death. He also tells Martha the details of his arrest for buying a stolen horse and requests her assistance in getting him out of prison. Autograph letter signed, 4 pages. with integral address panel.
